revised_title: Ultrasonic Dispersion in Halo-Methane Vapours: A Study of Molecular Structure and Vibrational Energy
tldr: The authors conducted ultrasonic measurements on lighter halo-methane vapours to investigate the relation between molecular structure and the ease of vibrational energy in collisions. They found that the number of collisions needed for a molecule to take up one quantum of vibrational energy runs parallel with the value of the lowest molecular vibration frequency. The study provides insights into the factors determining the collision life of vibrational energy in molecules.
